column1: Narrator : The island is massive. Far away, at the center, stands a tall mountain surounded by a thick forest.
Narrator : After walking for hours, NOMBATEAU is only a small dot on the horizon. CAPITAINE finally reaches the forest.
PlayerSpeak : All this walking just to go back…
Narrator : CAPITAINE walks deeper in the thickening forest, until a wall as tall as NOMBATEAU is blocking the way. The only way through is a closed gate.
Narrator : A dark and gloomy voice echoes from behind the trees.

column3: Narrator : A big rumble echoes through the swamp, scattering away a few frogs.
column4: Narrator : « You have spoken all the words »

column3: Narrator : « You have spoken the right word »
PlayerSpeak : I think we’re getting closer!

column1: Narrator : Without too much trouble, the crew retrace their steps to the forest’s entrance.
Narrator : The trees are so tall that one couldn’t see the top. A thick, greenish fog is surrounding CAPITAINE and the crew.
Narrator : An ancient rock is blocking the way. It's covered in moss but there are drawings and carvings on it.
column3: Narrator : CAPITAINE stands before the hole uncovered by the rock.

column1: Narrator : Without too much trouble, the crew retrace their steps to the forest’s entrance.

column1: Narrator :  Next to this are carved ten little coins.

column2: Narrator : Without too much trouble, the crew retrace their steps to the forest’s entrance.

column1: Narrator : There is a little angel carved next to the text.
Narrator : « Only the wicked heart may pass »
column2: Narrator : Without too much trouble, the crew retrace their steps to the forest’s entrance.

column1: Narrator : Next to the text is carved a little devil.
Narrator : Slowly, the rock rises from the floor and disappears in the sky, revealing in front of CAPITAINE a dark and deep hole.
Narrator : Without too much trouble, the crew retrace their steps to the forest’s entrance.
Narrator : After falling for a few seconds, CAPITAINE and the crew end up into an underground lake.
Narrator : The whole cave is lit by a dim blue light coming from a rocky corridor.
Narrator : On the walls, a crack is letting through a beam of sunlight.

column2: Narrator : CAPITAINE and the crew are back on the beach.
Narrator : They turn but it's too late, the crack closes behind them, like a cut turning into a scar.

column1: Narrator : The corridor leads to a massive room, carved in the rock. In the middle of it is a platform with a big shiny chest on top.
Narrator : As CAPITAINE steps on the platform, the walls start to rumble. A deafening clap of thunder cracks, as a blinding flash of light forces everybody to cover their eyes.
Narrator : When they regain their senses, four men with putrid faces are holding bloody swords right behind CAPITAINE.
OtherSpeak : This is the end of you, mortals.
Narrator : The cave has gone perfectly silent, except for the very faint singing of birds in the distance, heard from a hole in the ceiling.
Narrator : CAPITAINE ‘s dream is right in front of them.
Choice : (go back to the center of the cave)
